intro: Ctenadena lanata, commonly known as the woolly ctenadena, is a species of flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers are often visited by pollinators such as bees and butterflies, contributing to its ecological role in its native habitat. The plant's unique morphology and resilience make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
